Package camzup.core

Class Face2

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Face2
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Face2>, java.lang.Iterable<Edge2>
public class Face2
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<Edge2>, java.lang.Comparable<Face2>
Organizes components of a 2D mesh into a list of vertices that form a face. This is not used by a mesh internally; it is created upon retrieval from a mesh.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  Face2.Edge2Iterator
    An iterator, which allows a face's edges to be accessed in an enhanced for loop.
    static class  Face2.Vert2Iterator
    An iterator, which allows a face's vertices to be accessed in an enhanced for loop.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    Vert2[] vertices
    The array of vertices in the face's edge loop.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Face2()
    The default constructor.
    Face2​(Edge2... edges)
    Creates a face from an array of edges.
    Face2​(Vert2... vertices)
    Creates a face from an array of vertices.

    • rotateZLocal

      public Face2 rotateZLocal​(float cosa, float sina, Vec2 center)
      Rotates all coordinates in the face by the sine and cosine of an angle around the z axis. The face's mean center is used as the pivot point.
      Parameters:
      cosa - cosine of the angle
      sina - sine of the angle
      center - the center
      Returns:
      this face
      See Also:
      centerMean(Face2, Vec2), Vec2.sub(Vec2, Vec2, Vec2), Vec2.rotateZ(Vec2, float, Vec2), Vec2.add(Vec2, Vec2, Vec2)

    • set

      public Face2 set​(Edge2... edges)
      Sets this face's vertices to refer to those in an array of edges. Assumes that each edge's origin matches the preceding edge's destination, and so only the origins need to be registered.
      Parameters:
      edges - the edges
      Returns:
      this face

      public static boolean contains​(Face2 face, Vec2 point)
      Evaluates whether the face contains a point. Uses vertex winding (as opposed to casting a ray).
      Parameters:
      face - the face
      point - the point
      Returns:
      the evaluation
